title: thread 'rustc' panicked at [...] src/librustc_codegen_llvm/metadata.rs:75:22 (FromUtf8Error)

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
### Code I simply have a `Cargo.toml` file which transitively depends on the `futures-util v0.3.8` crate. That crate failed to compile before my code even started to be compiled. Extract of my `Cargo.toml` (including only crates that might be relevant to `futures-util`). ``` ... [dependencies] futures = "0.3.4" hyper = "0.13.7" reqwest = { version = "0.10.7", features = ["cookies"] } tokio = { version = "0.2.22", features = ["macros", "signal", "time"] } ... ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` $ rustc --version --verbose rustc 1.47.0 (18bf6b4f0 2020-10-07) binary: rustc commit-hash: 18bf6b4f01a6feaf7259ba7cdae58031af1b7b39 commit-date: 2020-10-07 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.47.0 LLVM version: 11.0 ``` ### Error output ``` $ cargo check --release --jobs 6 Updating crates.io index [...] Checking futures-util v0.3.8 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: FromUtf8Error { bytes: [0, 4, 154, 49, 168, 10, 66, 36], error: Utf8Error { valid_up_to: 2, error_len: Some(1) } }', src/librustc_codegen_llvm/metadata.rs:75:22 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.47.0 (18bf6b4f0 2020-10-07) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden error: could not compile `futures-util`. ```
Backtrace

I unfortunately couldn't reproduce the bug, likely due to the fact that crates were compiled in parallel (`--jobs 6`) and in a non-deterministic order. Simply running `cargo check --release --jobs 6` again succeeded. ``` N/A ```
